Goel, Ankur wrote:
> 
> Hi Gordon,
>                Thanks for your reply. A couple more questions.
>  
> 1. In Hertrix 2.x i s there a plan to use Java NIO  (asynchronous I/O)
> in Toe-Threads to improve the performance and scalability
> of Heritrix for very large web crawls ?

No current plan. The bulk of our IO is done via the Apache Commons 
HTTPClient library, version 3.1, which does not have an NIO option. 
Apparently there may be an NIO option in the following 
HttpCore/HttpComponents (HttpClient successor) version, but moving to 
that version is also currently unplanned.

Also, the impression I have from other reports is that NIO benefits are 
minor, and come with some new problems, except in very narrow 
situations. I suspect much greater performance benefits could be 
achieved with other optimizations, first.

> 2. How is politeness taken care of in Heritrix cluster configuration ?
>    Since 2 or more nodes in the cluster could be hitting the same server
>    without knowing that they are potentially violating politenss.

Whenever we run crawls split over multiple machines, we use a 
CrawlMapper processor to ensure (with a few small exceptions) that any 
hostname is only hit by a single machine.

- Gordon @ IA
